dataset.title: ETI WBD: World Biodiversity Database (Euphausiacea) in the Catalogue of Life

individualName.surName: Brinton E., Ohman M.D., Townsend A.W., Knight M.D. & Bridgeman A.L. (eds of Euphausiacea)

abstract.para: ETI is a non-governmental organization in operational relation with UNESCO, dedicated to improving on a global scale the quantity, quality and accessibility of taxonomic information. The ‘Euphausiids of the World Ocean’ database covers all 86 species of the order Euphausiacea (krill) in the oceans, and was produced at the Scripps Institution of Oceanography. It is part of ETI’s World Biodiversity Database. The full database is published on CD-ROM (ISBN 3-540-14673-3), and includes a fully illustrated multiple-entry key, a picture key, interactive distribution maps, and a special database treating larval development for most species.

address.deliveryPoint: Harborne Building, The University of Reading

gbif.citation: Species 2000 & ITIS Catalogue of Life: 23rd March 2016, ETI WBD (Euphausiacea)

sourceDatabase.authorsAndEditors: Brinton E., Ohman M.D., Townsend A.W., Knight M.D. & Bridgeman A.L. (eds of Euphausiacea)
